meaningMnemonic: Something that has <kanji>slice</kanji>d <kanji>new</kanji>ness into the world is a <vocabulary>novel idea</vocabulary>. It is <vocabulary>original</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>novel</vocabulary>. Just imagine the world as a place of things that are already done. If you want to get something new and novel in there, you have to slice that oldness open to make space for the new.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
